description: Reticulum v1.1.3 - request/response protocol test vectors

request_serialization_vectors.request_id_algorithm: truncated_hash(packed_request) — used for large requests sent as Resource

receiver_side.note: Receiver computes request_id = truncated_hash(packed_request) after resource transfer completes

policy_vectors.description: ALLOW_NONE: always blocked (even with valid identity)
ALLOW_LIST: identity not in list → blocked

round_trip_vectors.description: Near-MDU request (exact fit) with small response
Over-MDU request (resource) with small inline response

step_2_request_packing.request_id_algorithm: truncated_hash(packed_request) — large request sent as Resource

round_trip_vectors.description: Small inline request with over-MDU response (resource)

step_5_response_packing.note: Response sent as Resource with request_id and is_response=True

round_trip_vectors.description: Both request and response over-MDU (both as resource)

step_2_request_packing.request_id_algorithm: truncated_hash(packed_request) — large request sent as Resource

step_5_response_packing.note: Response sent as Resource with request_id and is_response=True

receipt_lifecycle_vectors.description: Inline request with inline response (simplest path)

callbacks_invoked.note: Called with receipt; receipt.response contains response data

receipt_lifecycle_vectors.receipt_response: Response data from unpacked response packet

callbacks_invoked.note: Called multiple times as resource segments arrive; receipt.progress updated
Called with receipt; receipt.response contains response data

receipt_lifecycle_vectors.receipt_response: Response data unpacked from completed resource

state_transitions.trigger: Request resource transfer completed (request_resource_concluded with success)

callbacks_invoked.note: Called with receipt; receipt.response contains response data

receipt_lifecycle_vectors.receipt_response: Response data from unpacked response packet
receipt_lifecycle_vectors.timeout_note: Response timeout timer starts after DELIVERED state

receipt_lifecycle_vectors.description: Resource request with resource response (full lifecycle)

state_transitions.trigger: Request resource transfer completed (request_resource_concluded with success)

callbacks_invoked.note: Called multiple times as response resource segments arrive
Called with receipt; receipt.response contains response data

receipt_lifecycle_vectors.receipt_response: Response data unpacked from completed resource
receipt_lifecycle_vectors.timeout_note: Response timeout timer starts after DELIVERED state

state_transitions.trigger: Request resource transfer completed (request_resource_concluded with success)

callbacks_invoked.note: Called with receipt; receipt.response is None

state_transitions.trigger: Request resource transfer failed (request_resource_concluded with failure)

callbacks_invoked.note: Called with receipt; receipt.response is None

receipt_lifecycle_vectors.failure_note: Resource transfer may fail due to link closure, timeout, or peer rejection

multi_handler.description: Final dict state after registering all 4 handlers

handler_deregistration_vectors.note: Steps are sequential — each builds on the previous dict state

handler_invocation_vectors.dispatch_algorithm: if len(inspect.signature(response_generator).parameters) == 5: response_generator(path, request_data, request_id, remote_identity, requested_at); elif == 6: response_generator(path, request_data, request_id, link_id, remote_identity, requested_at)

unpacked_request_indices.1: path_hash (16 bytes, used for handler lookup)

handler_invocation_vectors.dispatch_algorithm: if len(inspect.signature(response_generator).parameters) == 5: response_generator(path, request_data, request_id, remote_identity, requested_at); elif == 6: response_generator(path, request_data, request_id, link_id, remote_identity, requested_at)

unpacked_request_indices.1: path_hash (16 bytes, used for handler lookup)

handler_invocation_vectors.dispatch_algorithm: if len(inspect.signature(response_generator).parameters) == 5: response_generator(path, request_data, request_id, remote_identity, requested_at); elif == 6: response_generator(path, request_data, request_id, link_id, remote_identity, requested_at)

unpacked_request_indices.1: path_hash (16 bytes, used for handler lookup)

handler_invocation_vectors.description: Handler not found (path_hash not in request_handlers dict)
handler_invocation_vectors.behavior: Request silently ignored — no response sent, no error raised

handler_validation_vectors.note: Validation occurs in order: path → response_generator → allow policy

client_consequence.inline_request: PacketReceipt is proved via link-layer implicit proof, so PacketReceipt.status becomes DELIVERED. However, no response arrives. PacketReceipt.check_timeout() only fires when status == SENT, so timeout never triggers. RequestReceipt stays at SENT indefinitely. failed_callback is never invoked.
client_consequence.resource_request: Resource transfer completes, RequestReceipt transitions to DELIVERED. __response_timeout_job polls until timeout expires, then calls request_timed_out(). Since status == DELIVERED, failed_callback IS invoked.

client_consequence.inline_request: PacketReceipt is proved via link-layer implicit proof, so PacketReceipt.status becomes DELIVERED. However, no response arrives. PacketReceipt.check_timeout() only fires when status == SENT, so timeout never triggers. RequestReceipt stays at SENT indefinitely. failed_callback is never invoked.
client_consequence.resource_request: Resource transfer completes, RequestReceipt transitions to DELIVERED. __response_timeout_job polls until timeout expires, then calls request_timed_out(). Since status == DELIVERED, failed_callback IS invoked.

client_consequence.inline_request: PacketReceipt is proved via link-layer implicit proof, so PacketReceipt.status becomes DELIVERED. However, no response arrives. PacketReceipt.check_timeout() only fires when status == SENT, so timeout never triggers. RequestReceipt stays at SENT indefinitely. failed_callback is never invoked.
client_consequence.resource_request: Resource transfer completes, RequestReceipt transitions to DELIVERED. __response_timeout_job polls until timeout expires, then calls request_timed_out(). Since status == DELIVERED, failed_callback IS invoked.

client_consequence.inline_request: PacketReceipt is proved via link-layer implicit proof, so PacketReceipt.status becomes DELIVERED. However, no response arrives. PacketReceipt.check_timeout() only fires when status == SENT, so timeout never triggers. RequestReceipt stays at SENT indefinitely. failed_callback is never invoked.
client_consequence.resource_request: Resource transfer completes, RequestReceipt transitions to DELIVERED. __response_timeout_job polls until timeout expires, then calls request_timed_out(). Since status == DELIVERED, failed_callback IS invoked.

failure_callback_vectors.description: Response timeout after successful resource delivery
Policy block on resource-transport request (times out)
failure_callback_vectors.note: Indistinguishable from vector 1 at the client — both result in timeout after DELIVERED

failure_callback_vectors.description: Inline request with no response (handler not found or server drops)
failure_callback_vectors.behavioral_gap: PacketReceipt.set_timeout_callback(request_timed_out) is set in RequestReceipt.__init__. PacketReceipt.check_timeout() only fires when PacketReceipt.status == SENT. On a link with implicit proofs, the packet is proved delivered, so PacketReceipt.status becomes DELIVERED and check_timeout() never fires. RequestReceipt stays at SENT. failed_callback is never invoked.

failure_callback_vectors.description: Inline request policy-blocked (packet delivered but no response)
failure_callback_vectors.behavioral_gap: Same as vector 3: packet is delivered (link implicit proof), but server silently drops due to policy. PacketReceipt timeout never fires because PacketReceipt.status is already DELIVERED. RequestReceipt stays at SENT. failed_callback never invoked.
failure_callback_vectors.note: Client cannot distinguish policy-block from handler-not-found for inline requests

handler_error_vectors.expected_message: Invalid signature for response generator callback
handler_error_vectors.server_behavior: inspect.signature(response_generator).parameters has 4 entries. Neither == 5 nor == 6 branch matches. Raises TypeError. Exception propagates — no response sent.

handler_error_vectors.expected_message: Invalid signature for response generator callback
handler_error_vectors.server_behavior: inspect.signature(response_generator).parameters has 7 entries. Neither == 5 nor == 6 branch matches. Raises TypeError. Exception propagates — no response sent.

Handler is called with correct 5-param signature but raises RuntimeError during execution. Exception propagates from handle_request() — no try/except around the response_generator call. No response is sent.
Handler returns None. Line 897: 'if response != None' check fails. No response packet or resource is created. This is intentional — handlers may return None to indicate no response should be sent.
handler_error_vectors.note: Not an error — this is a valid handler behavior
